[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Gemini Control System defines requirements to streamline telescope operations and data acquisition.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Gemini supports astronomers, operators, and developers in planning, managing, and monitoring observations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Gemini integrates with telescope instruments and astronomical databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Gemini provides responsive interfaces for astronomers and operators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Gemini runs on scalable VME-based hardware systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Gemini interfaces with EPICS for real-time control and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Gemini uses secure TCP/IP protocols for data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The system optimizes memory usage for efficiency in real-time operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Gemini ensures 24/7 availability with planned maintenance and automated failover.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Gemini operates in diverse observatory conditions, ensuring compatibility across different environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Gemini links with remote systems for real-time data sharing and archival.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Gemini enables observation planning, data management, and instrument control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include astronomers, telescope operators, and system administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Gemini relies on external hardware and stable network connections for continuous operation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Gemini requires a functional EPICS framework and access to external astronomical databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: EPICS: Experimental Physics and Industrial Control System

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with EPICS for real-time telescope control and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall access astronomical catalogs to assist in observation planning.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow astronomers to create observation schedules and retrieve catalog data (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow operators to monitor and adjust instruments during operations (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard with multilingual support.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process control commands within 2 seconds (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 50 concurrent user sessions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store observation data, logs, and schedules (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall implement role-based access control and versioning.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow a modular architecture to facilitate maintenance and upgrades.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall adhere to EPICS control system standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with international data-sharing protocols.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet cybersecurity standards for secure operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on workload variations.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log and retain all critical events for auditing and troubleshooting.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Operational Workflows, user manuals, and system documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: EPICS standards, TCP/IP, and VME specifications.
